abstract: New Jersey Devils enter two-month final push of regular season in ninth place in Eastern Conference; goalie Cory Schneider hopes team will make playoffs, in part to fill shoes of his predecessor Martin Brodeur, whose number 30 jersey is set to be retired.
lead_paragraph: Schneider, the team’s No. 1 goalie for a season and a half, has made it his mission to get the Devils, who have missed the playoffs in four of the past five years, to the postseason.

headline.print_headline: Brodeur’s Successor Finds a Home and Is Helping the Devils Rebuild
headline.main: Cory Schneider, Brodeur’s Successor, Is Helping the Devils Rebuild

snippet: Schneider, the team’s No. 1 goalie for a season and a half, has made it his mission to get the Devils, who have missed the playoffs in four of the past five years, to the postseason....
